p: Given that Mimusops zeyheri is widely consumed by wild animals due to its sweetness, uncontrolled grazing is another major challenge mitigating its exploration. Other concerns include the high exploitation and the indiscriminate harvesting of Mimusops zeyheri as fuel, expansion of settlements and agriculture land, and collection of rootstocks for grafting [ 25]. The ineffective implementation of existing legislation for the protection and management of many forest trees has contributed to the challenges facing Mimusops zeyheri. For instance, Lape√±a, Turdieva, Noriega, and Ayad [ 23] indicated that many decision-makers are reluctant to enact laws that protect wild plants.
